CatDescriptText: Mrs. Robert DeLancey, 101 Cresswell Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 19, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you think that a business recession has hit the United States? If so, how has it affected you?" answer reads: "I would say yes.  My husband was unemployed for about three or four months and has just returned to work.  And my sister has not been able to get any work since she finished business school."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Robert DeLancey wearing light colored sleeveless striped shirt and dark hat, carrying shopping bag, standing in front of corner grocery store storefront with neon sign
